summary_variants.short_answer: Honolulu is the capital and largest city of the U.S. state of Hawaii, located on the island of Oahu.
summary_variants.kid_friendly: Honolulu is a warm, ocean-side city in Hawaii where lots of people live and many visitors go to the beach.
summary_variants.standard: Honolulu is the capital city of Hawaii, situated on the south shore of Oahu. It is a regional hub for tourism, U.S. military operations, and international business across the Pacific, with a metro population of roughly one million residents.
summary_variants.expert_notes: Mention port infrastructure, tourism-driven economy, and strategic location for Indo-Pacific defense.

notable_features: Proximity to Pearl Harbor and major military commands

meta.review_notes: 2025-01-10: Verified capital status, economic roles, and founding data via City and County site (Tier 3) and population via Census QuickFacts (Tier 1/2). Coordinates double-checked with NOAA dataset. Consensus marked high.
